_header: For her with woe I wake [ ] is so w[ ]
_description: Love song of which only a fragment survives — about 35 lines, possibly rhyming abab

OxfMagdMolton.Transcription:
[ ]ffor hir with wo i wake [ ] is so w[ ]I sike for hir [ ][ ]
                    with sorou þus uas me striue[ ] þus as me dight my deies in dole
                    to dr[ ][ ]To hir þat semely to any sight þat is so
                    bright and sweteAnd þat so wh[ ]de my myghtShuld as i haue herte
                    & [ ]I haue hir serued many days[ ]
OxfMagdMolton.Note:
Written at back of a one-leaf document, faded so much that practically
                    unreadable; whole is about 35 lines; transcribed lines from the
                    middle.
